definitions.definition: Describing a physical change of position or state .

subdefinitions.definition: From one position or location to another, horizontally or approximately so, or along a route visualised as "across".
examples: That vase isn't exactly central. Could you move it over a couple of inches?
I slid over to make room for him to sit down.
Please pass the chocolates over to me.
"Come over to my house and play!" — "Sure, I'll bring over a pizza."
He's driven over from Bristol.
In the future, when space travel is affordable to everyone, we'll be able to pop over to the Moon for a weekend.

subdefinitions.definition: Across from one side of something to the other.
examples: I need to cross the river. Can you take me over in your boat?
I looked up just as a helicopter flew over .

subdefinitions.definition: Up one side of something, across, and then down the other side.
examples: The fence is too high. I don't think I'll be able to get over .
The boiling milk bubbled over onto the cooker top.

subdefinitions.definition: Across something, such as an edge, and then downwards.
examples: The car rolled to the edge of the cliff and went straight over .

subdefinitions.definition: From an upright position to a horizontal one.
examples: He tipped the bottle over , and the water came gushing out.
That building just fell over !

subdefinitions.definition: So as to fold towards or onto itself.
examples: Bend the end of that wire over to make a hook.
He bent over to touch his toes.
The leaves have curled over .

subdefinitions.definition: On top of something, or so as to cover something.
examples: Paint it over with a darker colour.
It's starting to cloud over .

subdefinitions.definition: So as to reverse up/down orientation, or otherwise change orientation by rotating.
examples: Put the card face down, and don't turn it over until I say so.
I can't sleep on my back. I have to roll over onto my side.

subdefinitions.definition: So as to reverse or exchange position(s).
examples: Swap those cables over . The red one should be in the left socket.

definitions.definition: Expressing figurative movement from one position or state across to another.
examples: He came over to our way of thinking on the new project.
I switched over to Channel 9.
I signed the property over to him.
This advertisement doesn't clearly get the idea over .

definitions.definition: Indicating a direction or location away from the speaker, usually roughly horizontally or visualised as such.
examples: I'll see you over at the club.
Look over there!

definitions.definition: Thoroughly ; completely ; from beginning to end .
examples: Let's talk over the project at tomorrow's meeting.
Let me think that over .
I'm going to look over our department's expenses.

definitions.definition: To a high or excessive degree; overly ; see also over- .
examples: I'm not over bothered about going to the party.
If you're over tentative then you'll get nowhere.

definitions.definition: Beyond or in excess of what is correct or expected.
examples: The show ran ten minutes over .
We tried to stick to budget, but in the end we went twenty dollars over .
Carry the shortfall over and we'll make it up tomorrow.
We missed the last bus home so we stayed over .
Can I sleep over ?

subdefinitions.definition: Again ; another time; once more; over again.
examples: I lost my paper and I had to do the entire assignment over .

subdefinitions.definition: Used for rhetorical effect to reinforce that something was done the stated number of times.
examples: I said the magic word three times over , and the secret door slid open.

definitions.definition: See also individual entries for phrasal verbs: go over , hand over , run over , take over , win over , etc.

main_definition: Describing a physical change of position or state .
secondary_definitions: Expressing figurative movement from one position or state across to another.
Indicating a direction or location away from the speaker, usually roughly horizontally or visualised as such.
Thoroughly ; completely ; from beginning to end .
( often in compounds ) To a high or excessive degree; overly ; see also over- .
Beyond or in excess of what is correct or expected.
See also individual entries for phrasal verbs: go over , hand over , run over , take over , win over , etc.
